intro: Epiblastus torricellensis, commonly known as the Torricelli's epiblastus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are usually alternate and ovate, with a smooth surface and a waxy texture. Epiblastus torricellensis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on trees or rocks in its natural habitat.
